content.text: Use the data from the table to identify the metal used to make each block
A
B
C
Another metal block is made of brass. Its mass is \(200 \text{g}\)
The density of brass is \(8.4 \text{g} /\text{cm}^3\)
Calculate the volume of the brass block
Describe a method for determining the volume of a small, dense, irregularly-shaped object
You may draw a labelled diagram
Fig. 1.1 shows three metal blocks. Each block has the same mass
The volumes of the blocks are different
Each block is made of a different metal. The table gives the density of each metal
the distance from the man's home to the café
distance =   .........  \(km\)
the time taken to walk to the café
time =   .........  hours
the speed, in km/hour, of the man as he walks to the café
speed =   .........  \(km/hour\)
Using Fig. 2.1, determine
The man left home at 13:00
Determine the time when the man began his rest
time when rest began   .........
For how long did the man rest on the return journey? State the time in minutes
time =   .........  minutes
Describe, in words, how the graph in Fig. 2.1 shows that the man travelled at a slower speed on the return journey after resting
On the return journey from the café, the man stopped to rest
Fig. 2.1 shows a distance-time graph for a man walking from home to a café. At the café the man stops for a drink. On the return journey from the café, the man stops to rest

measurementmeasurement in metres
diameter of wheel35 cm
diameter of axle25 mm

content.text: The mass of the wheelbarrow is \(20\mathrm{kg}\). The mass of the load in the wheelbarrow is \(30\mathrm{kg}\)
Calculate the total weight of the wheelbarrow and its load
weight of wheelbarrow and load =   .........  N
A man lifts the handle of the wheelbarrow. He applies a force of \(140\mathrm{N}\), as shown in Fig. 3.3
Fig. 3.3
Calculate the moment of the force about the pivot. Include the unit
moment =

Explain why the flat-top cone is less stable when it is inverted
Fig. 4.1 shows a flat-top cone and a sphere, resting on a table
The car is lifted to point \(\mathbf{A}\) and then released. It continues along the track
Complete the sentences about the energy of the car using letters from Fig. 5.1
The car has maximum gravitational potential energy at point
The car has maximum kinetic energy at point
State the principle of conservation of energy
A machine lifts the car to point \(\mathbf{A}\). The machine is not \(100\%\) efficient
Suggest why the machine is not \(100\%\) efficient. Use your ideas about energy
Fig. 5.1 represents part of a roller coaster track

Thermal energy is transferred through the bottom of the metal pan by
Thermal energy is transferred throughout the water by
Complete the sentences to describe how thermal energy is transferred

Fig. 6.2

A student carries out an experiment to determine which surface is the better emitter of thermal energy. She uses two similar metal containers. One of the containers has a dull black surface. The other has a shiny white surface. Fig. 6.2 shows the metal containers on a bench
Fig. 6.1 shows a metal pan containing water being heated by an electrical heater
Explain why the ray of red light is totally internally reflected by the surface of the glass block
State the name of the process of separating white light into a spectrum
Write the names of the seven colours that appear on the screen between A and B
colour at A
colour at B
A ray of white light passes through a prism and produces a spectrum of colours on a screen, as shown in Fig. 7.2
Visible light is one part of the electromagnetic spectrum
State the name of **one** other part of the electromagnetic spectrum and describe a use of this type of radiation
name of radiation
use of radiation
Fig. 7.1 shows a ray of red light being reflected at the flat surface of a glass block
State the term given to the line XY
On Fig. 8.1, indicate the position of one principal focus of the lens. Label the principal focus, F
Fig. 8.1 shows an incomplete ray diagram of a converging lens forming an image of the object, O
On Fig. 8.1, draw a ray of light from the top of the object that passes through the lens to form the image. Use a ruler
On Fig. 8.1, draw the image formed by the lens. Label the image I
Choose words from the box that describe the image formed by the lens in Fig. 8.1
Draw a ring around each correct word
State the name of component B

State which materials are electrical conductors
Put a tick in the box next to each material that is an electrical conductor

He uses the circuit in Fig. 9.1

resistance =   .........  \(\Omega\)

The student moves the magnet to the right into the coil and then holds the magnet stationary for a few seconds. The pointer deflects to the right and then returns to the centre
The student then moves the magnet to the left so that it is completely out of the coil and moves it far away from the coil
